title: Why passengers always board flights from the left side explained
description: The ingrained habit of boarding aircraft from the left side stems from historical maritime traditions and practical aviation design. This convention enhances safety by separating passengers from busy ground operations on the right, where fueling and cargo loading occur. Pilots' left-side cockpit positioning also facilitates easier monitoring of this established boarding process.

Citing Venezuela's alleged use of oil revenues for illegal activities, Trump declared a massive naval buildup in South America. This military campaign, including strikes on vessels, aims to interdict drugs and potentially oust Maduro, according to administration officials.

title: Trump orders blockade of ‘sanctioned oil tankers’ into Venezuela, ramping up pressure on Maduro
description: Trump said the large U.S. naval armada amassed in the Caribbean “will only get bigger” until Venezuela returns “to the United States of America all of the Oil, Land, and other Assets that they previously stole from us.”

title: Vehicle ban chaos: Delhi restricts non-BS VI entry; commuters, residents slam abrupt move
description: Starting Thursday, a new Delhi government regulation prohibits non-BS VI vehicles from entering the capital. This sweeping ban threatens to throw daily commutes into chaos for countless commuters from regions like Gurgaon, Noida, and Ghaziabad. With over 200,000 vehicles impacted in Gurgaon alone, tensions are rising as many express discontent regarding the swift implementation and absent alternatives.

Surpassing Rs 200 crore net in its second week within just five days, the spy actioner is on track to exceed its opening week's earnings. The film's impressive performance, with an estimated Rs 411.

title: Communal clash in Ludhiana jail: Bricks fly, sirens wail as prisoners run amok

title: Many US student loan borrowers are unknowingly overpaying: Here’s what you must know to save
description: Many US student loan borrowers are overpaying without realising it, as awareness of federal relief programs remains low. Programs such as income-driven repayment plans, Public Service Loan Forgiveness (PSLF), Teacher Loan Forgiveness (TLF), and disability-based forgiveness can lower monthly payments or cancel debt entirely. Surveys show significant portions of borrowers are unaware of these options. Financial advisors urge borrowers to explore StudentAid.gov and related resources to access repayment plans, avoid default, and reduce overall student debt.
